DataElement.preferredName: Institution Patient Blinatumomab Outpatient Infusion Procedure Home Health Nursing Ind
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether a site would utilize home health care for outpatient infusions if a patient is randomized to a blinatumomab arm

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Institution Patient Blinatumomab Outpatient Infusion Procedure Home Health Nursing
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research as, a literary institution; also, a building or the buildings occupied or used by such organization._A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. _A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay._A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. _Professional nursing care provided within the home of the individual under care._

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research as, a literary institution; also, a building or the buildings occupied or used by such organization.

Concepts.definition: An established society, corporation, foundation or other organization founded and united for a specific purpose, e.g. for health-related research; also used to refer to a building or buildings occupied or used by such organization.

Property.preferredName: Patient Blinatumomab Outpatient Infusion Procedure Home Health Nursing
Property.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.:A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.:A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.:Professional nursing care provided within the home of the individual under care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

A recombinant, single-chain, anti-CD19/anti-CD3 bispecific monoclonal antibody with potential immunostimulating and antineoplastic activities. Blinatumomab possesses two antigen-recognition sites, one for the CD3 complex, a group of T cell surface glycoproteins that complex with the T cell receptor (TCR), and one for CD19, a tumor-associated antigen (TAA) overexpressed on the surface of B cells. This bispecific monoclonal antibody brings CD19-expressing tumor B-cells and cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTLs) and helper T lymphocytes (HTLs) together, which may result in the CTL- and HTL-mediated cell death of CD19-expressing B-lymphocytes.
A patient who comes to a healthcare facility for diagnosis or treatment but is not admitted for an overnight stay.
Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.
Professional nursing care provided within the home of the individual under care.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).
